intro: Griersonia, commonly known as the mountain bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It consists of several species native to South America, particularly in the Andean regions. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors, including white, purple, and blue. The leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a hairy texture. Griersonia species are often found in high-altitude environments, growing in rocky or alpine habitats.
